definition: frequent visitor/fig. sth that crops up frequently
always/ever/often/frequently/common/general/constant
surname Chang
customer/visitor/guest

sentences.english: Some of them were very regular.
sentences.chinese: 他們中的一些人是常客。

sentences.english: My girlfriend and I are habitual cinema-goers.
sentences.chinese: 電影觀衆我和女友是電影院的常客。

sentences.english: Oft-injured Larry Hughes should get more playing time in Pavlovic's absence.
sentences.chinese: 傷病常客休斯應該會得到更多的出場時間。

sentences.english: Similarly, night clubs purposely make patrons wait at the door.
sentences.chinese: 同樣的，夜店也會故意讓常客在門口大排長龍。

sentences.english: Suddenly the postman was a regular at the Hagadorn house.
sentences.chinese: 溘然，郵差成了艾米家的常客。

sentences.english: Now a frequent resident of many Sexiest Women In The World lists.
sentences.chinese: 現在是衆多世界最性感女人排名榜的常客。

sentences.english: We are frequent customers of that restaurant.
sentences.chinese: 我們是那家飯店的常客。

sentences.english: McKinsey, which usually contorts itself to stay out of the news, became a headline regular.
sentences.chinese: 一向遠離新聞焦點的麥肯錫成爲頭條常客。

sentences.english: Jack becomes a frequenter at Lijing restaurant since he knew Molly.
sentences.chinese: 自從認識了茉莉，傑克也成了麗晶酒店的常客。

sentences.english: Deng has so far managed to serve over 100 clients, most of whom are now her regulars.
sentences.chinese: 鄧梅目前已經有100多位客戶，大多數是常客。

sentences.english: In addition to free drink, the airline offers a frequent-flyer scheme.
sentences.chinese: 除了免費飲料，這家航空公司還實施常客獎勵計劃。

sentences.english: He was a frequent visitor in Marge and Bills home.
sentences.chinese: 他是比爾和瑪琪家的常客。

sentences.english: He eis a repeat customer, who is not just in need of a one-time product.
sentences.chinese: 他是一位常客，不僅僅是需要一種只買一次的產品。

sentences.english: Poached egg is usually seen in western breakfast.
sentences.chinese: 水波蛋是西式早餐的常客。

sentences.english: Suddenly the postman was a regular at the Hagadorn house.
sentences.chinese: 突然，郵差成了艾米家的常客。

sentences.english: Mr Goodman is a regular customer of ours.
sentences.chinese: 古得曼先生是我們的常客。

definition: tablet announcing the name of leading actor in a theatrical production/by extension, the lead role
guest of honor
not just in name only, but also in reality (idiom)
person of outstanding talent
well-known figure/excellent (person, company etc)
reckoned to be first or second best (idiom)/one of the very best/to list one by one
currently popular (of movie stars, singers etc)
old, well-known brand/old style/old school/an old hand/experienced veteran
crispy fried chicken
to be unwilling to pass on one's responsibilities to others
a favorite of sb in power/a celebrity/American Indian
can be counted on one's fingers (idiom)/very few
(argot) gang leader
famous/well-known
family firm producing a special product/cottage industry
resounding/loud/well known/famous
